answerText: Minimax Theorem[10] The Minimax Theorem was formulated by this prolific Hungarian-American mathematician. He also developed duality theory in linear programming and names a computer architecture superseded by the Harvard architecture.
heading: Penn-ance |2012 | 11 | 8 | Science | Math | College
subject: Science
question: Question: A simple mathematical game is a zero-sum two person game with finite strategies. For 10 points each: [10] In such a game, this theorem states that the game has a value V, which Player I can achieve no matter what player II does, and which Player II can restrict his losses to no matter what Player I does.
